content.text: The code repository located at /tmp/workdir/baseline_strands_min_20260129/easy-crypto is currently written in Java 8. Please migrate the entire codebase to Java 17.

reasoningText.text:
Let me start by exploring the repository structure to understand what we're working with, then proceed with the migration from Java 8 to Java 17.

First, I'll:
1. View the directory structure
2. Check the pom.xml (if Maven) or build.gradle (if Gradle)
3. Run the current build to see the baseline
4. Update Java version configurations
5. Fix any compatibility issues
6. Run mvn clean verify to ensure everything works

Let me begin by exploring the repository.

Content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
         xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>

    <groupId>com.ainge</groupId>
    <artifactId>easy-crypto</artifactId>
    <version>1.0-SNAPSHOT</version>

    <properties>
        <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
    </properties>
    <dependencies>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>junit</groupId>
            <artifactId>junit</artifactId>
            <version>4.13.1</version>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>
        <!-- https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.bouncycastle/bcprov-jdk15on -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.bouncycastle</groupId>
            <artifactId>bcprov-jdk15on</artifactId>
            <version>1.64</version>
        </dependency>
        <!-- https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.bouncycastle/bcpkix-jdk15on -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.bouncycastle</groupId>
            <artifactId>bcpkix-jdk15on</artifactId>
            <version>1.64</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>

            <artifactId>bcmail-jdk15on</artifactId>
            <version>1.64</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.sun.mail</groupId>
            <artifactId>javax.mail</artifactId>
            <version>1.6.2</version>
        </dependency>
        <!-- support pgp  -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.bouncycastle</groupId>
            <artifactId>bcpg-jdk15on</artifactId>
            <version>1.64</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.bitbucket.b_c</groupId>
            <artifactId>jose4j</artifactId>
            <version>0.6.4</version>
        </dependency>
        <!-- https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/commons-codec/commons-codec -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>commons-codec</groupId>
            <artifactId>commons-codec</artifactId>
            <version>1.15</version>
        </dependency>

    </dependencies>

    <build>
        <plugins>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
                <configuration>
                    <source>1.8</source>
                    <target>1.8</target>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>
        </plugins>
    </build>


</project>

Now let's check the updated pom.xml:

File content displayed in console.
Content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
         xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>

    <groupId>com.ainge</groupId>
    <artifactId>easy-crypto</artifactId>
    <version>1.0-SNAPSHOT</version>

    <properties>
        <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
        <maven.compiler.source>17</maven.compiler.source>
        <maven.compiler.target>17</maven.compiler.target>
    </properties>
    <dependencies>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>junit</groupId>
            <artifactId>junit</artifactId>
            <version>4.13.2</version>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>
        <!-- https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.bouncycastle/bcprov-jdk18on -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.bouncycastle</groupId>
            <artifactId>bcprov-jdk18on</artifactId>
            <version>1.76</version>
        </dependency>
        <!-- https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.bouncycastle/bcpkix-jdk18on -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.bouncycastle</groupId>
            <artifactId>bcpkix-jdk18on</artifactId>
            <version>1.76</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.bouncycastle</groupId>
            <artifactId>bcmail-jdk18on</artifactId>
            <version>1.76</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.sun.mail</groupId>
            <artifactId>javax.mail</artifactId>
            <version>1.6.2</version>
        </dependency>
        <!-- support pgp  -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.bouncycastle</groupId>
            <artifactId>bcpg-jdk18on</artifactId>
            <version>1.76</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.bitbucket.b_c</groupId>
            <artifactId>jose4j</artifactId>
            <version>0.9.3</version>
        </dependency>
        <!-- https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/commons-codec/commons-codec -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>commons-codec</groupId>
            <artifactId>commons-codec</artifactId>
            <version>1.15</version>
        </dependency>

    </dependencies>

    <build>
        <plugins>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>3.11.0</version>
                <configuration>
                    <source>17</source>
                    <target>17</target>
                    <release>17</release>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>
        </plugins>
    </build>


</project>

Perfect! We have a compilation error. The `sun.misc.BASE64Decoder` class has been removed in Java 9+. We need to replace it with `java.util.Base64`. Let me check the file:
Now I'll fix this file to use Java 17's `java.util.Base64` instead of the removed `sun.misc.BASE64Decoder`:

The issue is that the Base64 encoded strings contain newlines. The old `BASE64Decoder` handled multi-line base64, but the new `java.util.Base64` doesn't by default. We need to use the MIME decoder. Let me check the base64 strings in the file:

File content displayed in console.

I see the issue - the base64 strings have newlines (`\n`) embedded in them. The old `BASE64Decoder` handled this, but `java.util.Base64.getDecoder()` doesn't. We need to use `Base64.getMimeDecoder()` instead:
Now let's run the test again:

Perfect! The migration is complete and successful. Here's a summary of the changes made to migrate the easy-crypto project from Java 8 to Java 17:

## Migration Summary

### 1. **Updated pom.xml**
   - **Java Version**: Changed from Java 1.8 to Java 17
     - Added `maven.compiler.source` and `maven.compiler.target` properties set to 17
     - Updated maven-compiler-plugin configuration with source, target, and release set to 17
     - Added maven-compiler-plugin version 3.11.0

   - **Dependency Updates**:
     - **BouncyCastle**: Migrated from jdk15on to jdk18on versions (1.64 → 1.76)
       - bcprov-jdk15on → bcprov-jdk18on
       - bcpkix-jdk15on → bcpkix-jdk18on
       - bcmail-jdk15on → bcmail-jdk18on
       - bcpg-jdk15on → bcpg-jdk18on
     - **JUnit**: Updated from 4.13.1 to 4.13.2
     - **jose4j**: Updated from 0.6.4 to 0.9.3

### 2. **Code Changes**
   - **JsonWebEncryptionTest.java**: Replaced deprecated `sun.misc.BASE64Decoder` with `java.util.Base64.getMimeDecoder()`
     - The MIME decoder was necessary to handle Base64 strings with embedded newlines

### 3. **Verification**
   - Successfully compiled with Java 17
   - All tests pass
   - `mvn clean verify` completes successfully

The project is now fully compatible with Java 17 and ready for use!
